title: Not for us at all...
text: I'm not sure what we missed as this received so many good reviews but we did not like this attraction.  The museum is very informative and worth checking out and that may be why so many people rate this experience high, but the crocodile portion is disturbing.  The crocs are so lethargic they seem to almost not be alive.  I can't imagine how they are so docile... they say it is because they are well fed, but I would think they would have to be way overfed or medicated to lay around as they do. As soon as we entered the "pool" area and saw the crocodiles like that we walked right through and then out of the park.  I understand that animal attractions can harbor a lot of feelings and I entered into this with an open mind but I can't recommend.

title: Very enjoyable visit
text: What a fantastic couple of hours spent here. We walked from Cape Point (approx 20 minutes) with very little hassle so had the added bonus of seeing where the locals live. It is only D100 per person to enter although when you get to the crocodiles you are asked for a donation for their food. It's all written down in a book so you feel as though it will be used appropriately. The museum is fascinating and worth spending time in each room, although is all written in English so you may want a translation tool if you are not able to read in English. It is worth not rushing to the crocodiles if you love nature and spend some time the other side of the pool as we saw numerous birds including two types of kingfisher. There are also monkeys and rather randomly goats. If you are in the area you should make the visit and from further afield it would be worth negotiating a price with a local taxi driver. We didn't have a guide nor did we feel that we needed one.

title: BELLE EXPERIENCE
text:
Alors, nous sommes l√†, au c≈ìur de Bakau, en Gambie, et nous venons d√©couvrir le fameux Kachikally Crocodile Pool.
C'est incroyablement fascinant. Imaginez-vous, un site de 9 acres avec une piscine sacr√©e, un mus√©e ethnographique, un mini-sentier forestier, et m√™me une buvette √† proximit√©. C'est comme entrer dans un autre monde.
D√®s notre arriv√©e, nous sommes plong√©s dans cette atmosph√®re mystique. Les Gambiens locaux nous ont racont√© que ce lieu est r√©put√© pour ses pouvoirs de gu√©rison. Les gens viennent ici pour chercher des b√©n√©dictions, et certaines femmes st√©riles viennent m√™me prier pour concevoir. C'est impressionnant de voir √† quel point ce lieu est important pour la communaut√© locale.
En explorant la piscine, nous avons √©t√© √©tonn√©s de voir environ 80 crocodiles, certains somnolents sur les berges. Et le plus √©tonnant, c'est que nous sommes autoris√©s √† les toucher !
Alors pourquoi pas ? Apr√®s notre exp√©rience pr√©c√©dente avec les lions, rien ne peut plus nous arr√™ter ! Ces reptiles sont nourris exclusivement de poisson deux fois par semaine, et malgr√© leur proximit√© avec les marais sal√©s, l'eau de la piscine reste fra√Æche et accueillante. N√©anmoins, pas vraiment l'envie de plonger parmi eux, nous nous contentons de nous approcher par l'arri√®re et de les toucher
La peau est moins √©paisse que je l'imaginai, les √©cailles restent souples. Pour faire avancer le crocodile il faut presser n√©anmoins assez fortement la base de la queue
L'histoire et les l√©gendes entourant ce lieu sont tout aussi captivantes. On nous a racont√© comment le sanctuaire de la piscine a √©t√© r√©v√©l√© √† la famille Mandingue Bojang il y a plus de 520 ans. Une autre histoire parle d'une entit√© surnaturelle, une femme Djinn, qui aurait perdu son enfant ici, donnant ainsi naissance √† la sanctification du puits.
Et le mus√©e de Kachikally est tout simplement remarquable. Avec ses 1 000 artefacts historiques expos√©s dans quatre huttes rondes africaines, il nous plonge encore plus profond√©ment dans l'histoire de Bakau et des nombreux groupes ethniques de la Gambie. C'est comme un voyage dans le temps, une immersion totale dans la culture et les traditions locales.
En fin de compte, notre d√©couverte du Kachikally Crocodile Pool et de son mus√©e restera grav√©e dans nos m√©moires comme une exp√©rience inoubliable. C'est vraiment une perle rare, un tr√©sor de la Gambie que nous sommes reconnaissants d'avoir eu l'occasion de d√©couvrir.

title: Fantastic
text:
Visted around 11am and it seems to be a good time to go. Not busy or rushed. Guide was knowledge and good fun. A wonderful opportunity to find out and get up close to these fascinating animals.
They are well cared for and happy to tolerate humans as they are well fed. Do listen to the guide as some pregnant crops will not be so happy to be approached. 
Great local information in  series of rooms on the way in about tribes, musical instruments, and info about military history.
Entrance fee 100 D and an opportunity to leave a contribution to help towards food for the crops.

title: Kort maar krachtig üêä
text:
Heel klein, je bent er zo doorheen. Entree 100D (ongeveer 1,36‚Ç¨)
Je komt binnen in een heel klein museum, dat niks met krokodillen te maken heeft. Maar wel interessant is. Daarna is het een stukje lopen en sta je tussen de krokodillen. Deze zijn heel rustig. Sommige leken wel levende beelden. Je mag ze even aanraken, daar reageren ze niet op (dus geen last van) De krokodillen zouden zo rustig zijn omdat ze veel voedsel krijgen en dus niet hoeven te jagen (een krokodil kan dagen zonder eten) dus ze liggen daar uit te buiken. Ook zouden de krokodillen vegetarisch zijnü§£ 
Er ligt op het eind een boek waarin je je naam kunt zetten en een bijdrage kunt doen. Daar vriendelijk voor bedankt. 
Stel je er niet teveel van voor.

title: Croc Pool

text: Different experience, touching crocodiles. We went with a local guide Lamin Marong, who picked us up from hotel , drove to the pool, guided us through the museum and then to the pool, where a keeper told us which ones we could touch, then Lamin drove us back, with a brief visit to a war graves cemetery, all for ¬£20

text:

title: Don't Shed Tears for These Crocodiles
text: Over a dozen crocodiles laying al around the pool, mostly sleeping.  You get to walk a path with your guide around the place when suddenly you notice there is no fence between you and those crocodiles about 4 feet away.  Luckily, only a few are moving and you are really glad they were fed earlier in the day.  I would question your fitness as a parent if you brought your kiddos on your visit.  Just remember if you want to touch one (and people do) touch the crocodile as far away from its mouth as possible.  If you love Komodo Island and its free roaming dragons you will like this place.

title: Leuk om eens te zien maar het stelt niet heel erg veel voor!
text: We hadden een fietstour geboekt en dit was een van de stops. Als eerste ga je naar binnen bij een klein museumpje wat ook op dit park is. Onze gids heeft de vrouw bij de deur wat geld gegeven dus ik weet zelf niet wat de entree is. Je ziet hier aan de hand van foto's met Engelstalige uitleg en Afrikaanse maskers een stukje geschiedenis van Gambia. Het stelt weinig voor eerlijk gezegd. Je loopt er aan de achterkant weer snel uit naar de krokodillen waar het om gaat. Leuk om eens te zien. Er liggen er veel, zo'n 100 zouden er daar leven. Het is tevens een soort opvang hebben we begrepen. Er zitten ook veel "begeleiders" bij. Ze zijn vriendelijk en helpen om leuke foto's te maken van jou en de krokodillen als je dat wilt. Je mag 1 krokodil ( de albino) ook aanraken om foto's te maken als je wilt. Hier wordt geen geld voor gevraagd. De krokodillen liggen overal en nergens (vooral ook veel in de vijver die bedekt is met veel blad dus die zie je niet) en je loopt er gewoon omheen. Er wordt gezegd waar je het beste kunt lopen zodat het veilig is. Na zo'n 20 minuten heb je het wel gezien. Daarna wordt er wel gevraagd om een kleine bijdrage om vis te kunnen kopen voor de krokodillen. Ook wordt er een tafeltje met spullen geshowd (stiften, kleurboeken etc.) Ze proberen je dit te laten kopen voor de kinderen die je nog gaat zien in Gambia. Je kunt het dan uitdelen. Wij hebben dit niet gedaan maar wel wat geld gegeven voor de vis en de moeite die ze deden om leuke foto's van ons te maken.

title: √† voir
text:
very interesting site, apparently in activity since centuries. 
There is a little interesting museum, a  park and LOTS of crocodiles.
You may even touch some of them. 
The explanations given by the guide on how the keep the crocodiles number under control were not convincing at all, so we remain with the question.

title: Interesting and fun
text:
Never believed I could be comfortable walking amongst a bunch of very large crocodiles, and even petting one, but I was. There is an interesting history to this place. The owner has fed the crocs only fish for their entire lives, and they have been acclimated to people, so as long as you follow their instructions to move slowly and ONLY pet their backs, you are safe.

Makes for a great photo op! And the museum outside is definitely worth a stop.

title: Awesome Experience
text: This must see site was in walking distance from.our hotel,but it did mean a walk through Bakau old town which is a poverty striken area with lots of kids begging for sweets, so I was glad we hired a guy of the beach to take us there, as his presence made the journey there very easy.  The entrance fee is only 100 DL ( just over ¬£1) and there is an interesting museum about the history of Gambia to go through before one hits the jungle trail. There is a well trodden path, through some huge trees and local monkeys until you hit the pool, where rangers will arrange for visitors to pose with and touch the crocs for some great photo opportunities.  These are fresh water crocs and are fish eaters, and well fed. So humans are quite safe, but even do ard visitors are told to keep well away from the crocs mouths in case you confuse the crocs and they take a bite. If you are lucky on your visit you may get to see Charlie the albino Croc. A good and cheap way to spend a couple of hours.

title: Crocodile
text: Gemengde gevoelens omdat ik niet hou van de exploitatie van dieren maar er is me verteld dat er goed voor de dieren en nakomelingen gezorgd wordt. Dan is het wel een bijzondere ervaring tussen de krokodillen te lopen en ze aan te raken

title: Fantastic experience
text: This was my 2nd visit to Katchikally Crocodile Pool once again it was a remarkable wondrous experience. We went quite late in the day plus it was ramadan time so it was very quiet. We were the only people there. There was a 200 delacies entrance fee. Before going to see the crocodiles there is a small museum we walked around which consisted of 3 rooms with information  about the area , pictures and a few historical artefacts. The whole way round we were accompanied by a cat. He literally walked everywhere with us until we got to the exit of the rooms. Instinctively the cat stopped at the door and left us to continue out towards the crocodiles. She obviously knew not to go out there around the crocodiles, we stopped at a very ver old massive cotton tree on the way towards the crocodiles. The young man who cared for the crocodiles were so informative and put us at ease as when we got out towards the crocodiles. On this occasion, there were plenty of them out on the land. We counted at least 12 crocodiles amongst leaves and against the trees. This was a scarily wonderful experience to be this close to the crocodiles, we even saw the albino crocodile which was so big. The young man showed us the crocodile eggs and told us about the crocodiles. We made a small donation towards feeding the crocodiles as they must go through a large amount of fish to keep them going. This was a fantastic experience. Definitely not for the faint hearted.

title: Pool of Crocs
text:
Located about 30 minutes from Banjul, in the Bakau district, is the Kachikally Sacred Crocodile Pool believed by the locals for its healing powers and as a place of last resort for infertile women who wish to conceive.  the women seeking the special blessing are washed by trained women and are told not to shake hands with anyone in Bakau. Others with ailments come to the pool to seek luck and make offers to the crocs in return.  The walk to the pool is reached from the mail road by a 600-meter dirt pathway that is lined by poverty-stricken housing and dozens of young children approaching you asking for money or school supplies.

The  entrance wall is colorfully painted with wildlife scenes. Once inside, you walk on a path towards the pool where it is said that there are over 80 crocodiles in and around the pool  but we only saw four small crocks. The well-fed crocs are docile.  Visitors are allowed to touch or stroke the tail--not the head.  

Expect to spend about 30 minutes in the facility.  Other than the few crocs there is not much to see.  Worth a visit if you are in the area but otherwise not much to see although it is described as a popular tourist site.  At the end of the tour the owner requests "donations" to feed the crocs.

title: Superrrr
text:
Super heerlijk genoten in Gambia bij de crocodile pool! 

Ik raad mensen aan echt een lokale gids te nemen: veel meer persoonlijke aandacht, je steunt de locals en zit niet met 60 man in een busje haha. Heel de dag priv√© chauffeur mee voor niets. Tip, wij hadden het met Abdul geregeld, super leuke gast! (www. abdul-gambia. nl)

title: Lots of Crocs!
text:
Yes this is good to do if staying in the area, but you will need a taxi to get there. The park itself is off the main highway and at the bottom of a very local impoverished area.
Entrance fee is 100 dalasi per adult (guides/ drivers free). You do not need a guide for this attraction. 
There‚Äôs a very small museum beside the park, a very short walk to the crocodile pool and that is all there is. 
You can ‚Äústroke‚Äù the albino crocodile, see others lying around in the sun and there‚Äôs opportunity  to make a donation towards the cost of feeding them. Allow 30-45 mins max for this attraction. 

Truthfully the poverty on the streets surrounding the park was more of an experience and impacting than seeing the crocodiles but that‚Äôs the reality of living in The Gambia‚Ä¶.for some life is very hard.

title: A very worthwhile trip.
text: My wife and I visited the crocodile pool whilst on a recent holiday in Bakau. We hired the services of an excellent  local tour guide, Babucarr Fofana. Babu's office is in a street kiosk directly in front of the Ocean Bay Hotel in Bakau. Babu took us on a walk around Bakau to see some sights we were interested in. We went to the National Botanical Gardens, where Babu organised for us to tour the gardens with the Director of the gardens, who explained the plant species we were viewing and the relevance of the plants to the Gambia ecology and economy. Babu then took us to the Bakau Community School and onwards to the Katchikally Crocodile Pool. Babu gave us a guided tour of the museum at the pool and then the pool itself. He is a very knowledgeable guide with excellent English. Babu said we would have the opportunity to stroke the crocodiles, but what he hadn't told us was that they are free to roam the grounds. At first we found this a little alarming, but the pool guide explained that the crocodiles were fed every morning and that they would then not be interested in people unless disturbed. Indeed, all the crocodiles were sunning themselves and quite amenable to being stroked....carefully. The purpose of the pool and the crocodiles was explained to us and its continuing importance in Gambian folklore and society. All in all an excellent and interesting trip.

title: Want to see crocs? Well, you saw them. That‚Äôs it.
text: Maybe twenty or thirty lame crocs sleeping around or inside the pond. They do not move. You may even touch them. That‚Äôs it. You sat half an hour in the taxi to get there.

title: Educational visit to a well managed and inexpensive nature site.
text:
After paying 100 dalasi each, we passed the small museum walking along a smooth shaded lane to the pool entrance.  Here we were met by the middle aged caretaker who gave us a 15 minute tour that included touching the back of a well fed male albino crocodile who was resting peacefully among 15 more of normal color. He showed a video of their morning feeding, tossing plump fish from a full wheelbarrow as the crocs emerged from the pool in increasing numbers. He then guided us along the pool trail pointing out the unapproachable aggressive females and several semi submerged crocs among the 80 that live around this pool. 
Further along, we stopped to admire an old Kapok with huge buttress roots when a monkey appeared that was nursing babies. Finally we were shown a rice field(matured at the end of the wet season) soon to be harvested and prepared for planting dry season vegetables. 
Before departing, we signed a book to make a small contribution to feeding the crocs.  
Delightful ¬Ω hour visit.

title: ausbeutung : eintrittspreis 16‚Ç¨ in deutschland werde abkassiert aber nichts davon landet beim besitzer der farm
text: ich bin ziemlich sauer, dass hier eintrittspreise √ºber dieses portal verkauft werden f√ºr 16‚Ç¨, aber der besitzer der krokodilfarm dar√ºber gar keine kenntis hat. ich war vor ort der eintrittspreis liegt bei 2‚Ç¨ / 100  dalasi. davon bewirtschaftet er alles. von den 16‚Ç¨ kommt kein einziger ent bei denen an. ich frage mich, was das soll ????? mit welchem recht bereichern sich hier die deutschen an den sowieso schon armen menschen ? hier kostet ein brot 10 alasi / 18 cent. 16‚Ç¨ umgerechnet 878 dalasi, dann w√§re hier jemand sehr reich. hier essen die bewohner mittags , nachmittags und abends reis , meist mit sauerampfer oder einer so√üe aus obst hergestellt. k√∂nnen sich keine milch und keine sonstiges gem√ºse / obst leisten. was sagt ihr alle dazu ? ich bin der meinung buchen ausschlie√ülich dort bezahlen und bei 2‚Ç¨ sind spenden sehr gerne gesehen, wenn ihr die 16‚Ç¨ dann vor ort spendet, wisst ihr, dass das geld auch tats√§chlich dort ankommt. anstehen muss hier keiner. das gilt √ºbrifens auch f√ºr die sogenannten safaritouren, wo diese farm mit drin ist. ich hatte ein interview mit dem besitzer, daher wei√ü ich das. ich wollte n√§mlich wissen, was der eintritt kostet und ob ich noch wechseln gehen muss. nach diesem ergebnis war und bin ich immer noch zu tiefst entsetzt. das w√ºrde man sich in deutschland nicht wagen, da man auf schadensersatz klahgen kann. sich aber auf kosten von so armen menschen die taschen voll zu machen finde ich an dreistigkeit nicht zu √ºberbieten.

title: Interessanter als gedacht
text:
Die meisten Touristen kommen hierher, um mal ein Krokodil zu streicheln - schon ein besonderes Erlebnis, wenn man die normalerweise vorhandene Aggressivit√§t und Reaktionsschnelle der Tiere kennt.
Allerdings ist die Anlage auch seit Jahrhunderten eine Art Wallfahrtsort zu einer (nach wie vor vorhandenen) Heilquelle. Die Geschichte und Legende sollte man sich unbedingt zu Gem√ºte f√ºhren, dann √§ndert man vielleicht auch den Blick...
Das kleine Museum direkt nach dem Eingang vermittelt interessante Details √ºber die Traditionen der verschiedenen St√§mme Gambias.
Dar√ºber hinaus kann man - wenn man mit entsprechend offenen Augen unterwegs ist - eine Vielzahl von V√∂geln und mit Gl√ºck auch andere Tiere entdecken.

title: Highlight of our trip.
text: Loved it here. Great experience and the staff were brilliant. Highlight of our trip. Lovely museum with some interesting history.

title: Good for quick stop
text:
The entrance is just 100 dalasis to the museum which will tell you quite a lot about history of Gambia. There is also pretty good toilet. The ‚Äúpool‚Äù is just a few seconds walk from the museum and it is ‚Äúfree‚Äù as it is included in museum fee. I am seriously against to touching while animals and make me sad that so many people taking ‚Äúcool‚Äù photos while ‚Äúsitting‚Äù on crocodiles. 
There are 3 parts ‚Ä¶ one where you can go to crocodiles very close and touch them. Pool where you can‚Äôt go close to them as they are aggressive (well that‚Äôs their nature right?) and then where you can see babies.  I have had great guy to talk to and we were joking and talking not just about crocodiles but life generally. You can contribute some money if you wish to keep this place running and I think it‚Äôs worth it

title: Don't Expect Much
text:
After visiting the Crocodile Pool. 

The Museum is small but very informative/interesting history of the Gambia. You will learn about the ancestral rituals, music, history of the British colonisation until recent days...By itself this was a good highlight for me.

The Crocodile Pool itself, is a rather muddy pool surrounded by trees and occupied by an assortment of tame crocodiles that do very little. Didnt take any photos with the crocodiles, because it didnt felt right for me.

It is an Okay way to spend an hour or two. Just don't expect a major tourist attraction

title: Enjoyed The Guided Tour
text: Take some fish with you and watch them been fed your offering, great guided tour and entertaining comments

title: We stroked a crocodile
text:
First there is some interesting museum
pieces about the tribes etc. Then you go to the pool. The guy who looks after the crocs really knows them well and you can tell he cares for them. You can stroke the crocodile under the supervision of their keeper. 
Plenty of opportunity to donate to the upkeep of the crocs. Don‚Äôt buy the exercise books on offer at the price they ask for, so much cheaper in the shops!

title: Interesting excursion
text: The site actually starts with a small museum with different rooms on Gambian culture - traditions, music, war etc. Then you go to see the crocodiles where the knowledgable keeper will tell you all about them and you can take photos. I think entry is 100D and then you can make a donation to the care of the crocodiles too. Good place to combine with other places to visit - we then went to Serekunda Market.

title: Tocar cocodrilos
text: Es una visita obligada si vienes a Gambia. Si tienes ni√±os mejor. La visita comienza pasando por un peque√±o museo de la historia de Bakau, donde puedes ver fotograf√≠as hist√≥ricas y objetos tradicionales (trajes, tambores, jujus, etc‚Ä¶).  Muy espectacular un √°rbol pie de elefante que hay antes de llegar al recinto de los cocodrilos. Aunque la piscina de cocodrilos no tiene un tama√±o muy espectacular, lo cierto es que lo compensan con la posibilidad de echarte fotos tocando los cocodrilos.

title: Close up experience
text: If you have never been close to animals like these before it's probably a life times experience for you, although they are so well fed they are not very active but it is possible to touch them which gives most people a thrill. Should visit this place if just for the historic connection of Katchikally.

title: Lots and lots of crocodiles including the elusive albino Charlie
text: This was a really bizarre experience. The guide was telling us that it was perfectly safe to stroke the crocodiles and have photos taken with them. The reptiles were practically comatose, now bearing in mind that they are cold blooded creatures, they should have been very lively indeed in a temperature of 34-36 degrees. When questioned about the state of their inertia we were told that they have been trained to only perceive fish as food, which l am sorry to say was a complete and utter load of Croc! They were undoubtedly sedated which was very sad to see and l and 1 other in our group refused to participate in such a farce.

title: Interesting museum and crocodile pool
text:
Place was easy to locate - look out for the colorful wall 
It cost $100 to visit the museum and pool 
Although museum was small it had a lot of info about the music, culture, women, history and nature of Gambia 
Th√© croc pool was small but interesting as g√¢t√©s were left open 
You are encouraged to wander inside, with guide to bring you close to them which we declined 

We prefer to let sleeping crocodiles alone 

The kids were more aggressive though - with endless demands for soccer balls, physical items, money and all things under the sum. 
Watch out for them instead.

title: ... recht kurzes aber einmaliges Vergn√ºgen
text:
√úberraschender Weise war es tats√§chlich ein recht kurzes Vergn√ºgen. Der angepriesene Krokodil-Pool entpuppt sich als doch recht kleiner Teich mit vielen Krokodilen. Gott sei Dank sind alle recht gut gef√ºttert, quasi satt, so dass wir die drau√üen rumliegenden Krokodile ohne Angst streicheln/anfassen konnten. 
Anbei ist noch ein kleines Museum zur Geschichte von Gambia.
Alles in allem war es ein ganz ordentlicher Ausflug, zumal auf dem Hin- und R√ºckweg, quer durch die anliegenden D√∂rfer, zus√§tzlich noch ein Einblick zur Lebensweise der Gambianer gewonnen werden kann.
Bezahlt haben wir daf√ºr umgerechnet 60 ‚Ç¨.

title: Superbe exp√©rience
text: Incontournable pour une visite de Banjul car exp√©rience incroyable. Vous ne risquez absolument rien et pourtant je n'√©tais pas convaincue. Les guides sont tr√®s sympas et vous rassureront si vous avez encore des r√©ticences. A faire absolument. 100D, c'est donn√© donc une petite donation s'impose:)

title: Divertente!
text:
Un piccolo museo, un percorso nella foresta e questa pozza in cui vivono coccodrilli che si possono toccare. In effetti √® abbastanza strano, ma li abbiamo toccati tutti ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è. La leggenda dice che chi si bagna nelle sue acque riceve figli o fortuna, a seconda di ci√≤ che desidera. Naturalmente non si pu√≤ entrare dentro, un addetto recupera un secchio d'acqua se glielo chiedi. 
I dintorni cozzano un po' con questa zona turistica. Discarica a cielo aperto, fogne a cielo aperto, tanta povert√†.. mio marito, gambiano lui stesso, c'√® rimasto male.

title: Filthy pool, to many crocs in a to small environment
text: The reason we went there is the small museum. There you can learn about the culture, especially Mandinka, but also about history. We loved it

title: Strange, different but wonderful!!
text:
What a great place! This is not a zoo, this is where the crocodiles choose to stay and live, they are free to leave if they want, we loved to see this natural place and pool and the crocodiles are very calm, looks peaceful!
Ask your guide and they will help you! Count on about 2 hours to walk around! Bring some cash and give about 5-10‚Ç¨ in tip inside to the crocodile manager, the money is for fish to feed the crocodiles in the mornings!
Well worth the time and that small amount of money!

title: ≈öpiƒÖce krokodyle
text:
W porze suchej dla krokodyli jest za gorƒÖco. ≈öpiƒÖ w cieniu. Mo≈ºna je spokojnie dotknƒÖƒá (pod nadzorem).
Dziwne uczucie. Na ≈ºart mojej ≈ºony "≈ºe chyba sƒÖ z plastkiku"-pan sie zdenerwowa≈Ç i z≈Çapa≈Ç gada za ogon i zaczƒÖ≈Ç ciƒÖgnƒÖ. Ten sie obudzi≈Ç , wyrwa≈Ç i uciek≈Ç do wody.

title: N√¶rkontakt med krokodiller
text: Her kan du g√• rundt et lite tjern der det er fullt av krokodiller 2-3 meter lange. Man m√• g√• med en guide som kjenner krokodillene og vet hvilke som er agressive og hvilke som er rolige. Det har visstnok kke v√¶rt noen u√∏nskede hendelser, men dette synes jeg var veldig ubehagelig. Er det virkelig trygt? Og har de gjort noe med krokodillene for at de skal holde seg rolige? Ikke vet jeg, men jeg skal ihvertfall ikke tilbake hit.

title: Crocodile Park
text:
I visited the crocodile park. I found the Museum small but very informative with a lot of history.
I was shocked to see a crocodile just lay in the park, unmoving with its mouth wide open, the only thing that moved was its eyes, it must surly be drugged to stay like this. I did have a photo taken with it, like every one else but I now wish I hadn't

title: Tegen betaling van 100 dalasi een krokodil aaien... tja
text:
Entree 100 dalasi. Aaien krokodil (wachtrij, super commercieel) nog 100 dalasi.

Er is vanaf de entree eerst een best aardig museum waar je doorheen loopt over de geschiedenis van Gambia. Als je met je eigen taxichauffeur komt (hij mag gratis naar binnen) kan die wat meer uitleg geven. Daarna loop je een soort klein park in met een meertje waar wat krokodillen in/naast liggen. Als je er een (die geen vlees maar vis eet) wil aaien moet je in de rij op je beurt wachten. Na het aaien moet je je naam in een boek zetten en betalen. In een half uur sta je weer buiten.

De "pool" ligt in een arme wijk, kinderen stormen op je af zodra je de taxi uit stapt. Neem wat verpakte koekjes, snoepjes of lollies mee... daar zijn ze erg blij mee.

title: Z gadami
text: Bardzo ciekawe miejsce, krokodyle swobodnie bez klatek wylegujƒÖ siƒô na polanie aTy mo≈ºesz go dotknƒÖƒá byle nie w g≈Çowƒô. Polecam

title: Crocs up close
text: Great to be able to touch these terrifying animals. Amazing to see up close. and in a natural environment.

title: Krokodillen
text: Met onze prive gids heeft hij ons een rondleiding gegeven. Als 1e een stuk geschiedenis over Gambia. Erg interessant en merkt ook emotie bij de gids. Vervolgens naar de krokodillen. Ze krijgen vis te eten i.p.v. vlees waardoor ze rustig worden en niet agressief. Jaja hierdoor kan je ze aanraken. Vond het wel even eng maar blij dat ik het gedaan heb. Je deed dit samen met de man die daar werkt en ook leuke verhalen verteld en van humor houdt.

title: Inget att bes√∂ka
text: Inte v√§rt ett bes√∂k, var krokodilerna drogade?? De mest intressanta var att vi gick hem efter bes√∂ket hos crocsen, rekommenderas att g√• genom omr√•det f√∂r att f√• tr√§ffa lokal befolkningen. Det √§r fritt att g√• i parken, man m√•ste inte anlita en guide, vilket dom g√§rna vill att man g√∂r.

title: Great place
text:
Well there can‚Äôt be many places in the world where you can have your photo taken stroking a crocodile.
The history of this sacred pool is very interesting and being so close to the crocodiles is an amazing experience.

title: Krokodillen zijn wel lieve beestjes!
text: Bezoek met plaatselijke gids. Eerst het museum met wat geschiedenis, voodoorituelen en plaatselijke muziekinstrumenten. Daarna een wandeling door wat bos en plots sta je tussen een hoop krokodillen die ervan genieten om geaaid en gemasseerd te worden. Een leuke ervaring.

title: If you have never seen a croc....
text:
If you have seen crocs before: Don't go!
If you have not and are with children: You might consider!
If you go alone: Take a taxi! The streets to the Pool are narrow, dirty and VERY lokal.

title: Spotkanie z krokodylem
text:
Zobaczysz oraz dotkniesz krokodyla w tym parku. Krokodyle chodzƒÖ swobodnie po obiekcie bez klatek oraz bez terrari√≥w. Gady karmione sƒÖ rybami przez obs≈Çugƒô. W porze suchej krokodyle nie wykazuj du≈ºej aktywno≈õci, w przeciwie≈Ñstwie do pory deszczowej gdzie ich aktywno≈õƒá znacznie wzrasta.
Polecam wycieczkƒô z lokalnym przewodnikiem:

title: Dichtbij de krokodillen
text: Een klein museum over de voodoo van Gambia en muziekinstrumenten en een poel vol krokodillen. Leuk om te zien.

title: krokodillen aaien
text: Leuke excursie in Gambia met krokodillen aaien als hoogtepunt, ook een leuk klein museum ophet terrein aanwezig

title: 6 in 1 Trip
text: One of our excursions, and part of the 6 in 1. Very good especially stroking the crocodiles with a walk around the park.

title: Krokodillenpool
text: Wij hebben het bezocht met een plaatselijke gids. Bijzonder om zo tussen de krokodillen te lopen. De wandeling er naar toe heeft vooral veel  indruk op mij gemaakt. Zie je een stukje van het echte leven in Gambia.  Terug gelopen over de plaatselijke markt. Bizar

title: Not big but nice!
text:
We went there and it was just a short trip from sun beach hotel just 20 min. walk trough bakau.
They have a albino crocodile there Charlie which is portriad in the watermark on the money. If you're lucky you can see him but he's in the water a lot

title: Krokotiili lammikko
text: P√§√§si taputtelemaan krokotiileja jotka j√§√§hdytteliv√§t varjossa tai auringossa kidat auki. Vaikka vaikuttavia petoja tuntui kuin ne olisi huumattu, mutta hoitajien mukaan ei. Vaikea l√∂yt√§√§ ilman paikallista taksia

title: Uitstapje krokodillen
text: Mooi om te zien hoe deze dieren beschermd worden in een rustgevende omgeving en er goed voor hen gezorgd wordt!

title: Cute little place
text: Little museum on the way in then time to get close to the crocs, a guide will talk you through the history and take pics for you, try to take pens, books etc for the local kids as they are all there when you come out (there's a little shop if you aren't prepared)

title: Leuk om heen te gaan
text: Leuk om te kijken ,maar het is niet zo groot, je loopt 1 rondje en dan ben je er weer uit ,maar wel veel info bij het begin over het land

title: Leuk om te ervaren
text: Leuk om eens mee te maken, lopen tussen de krokodillen, 1 krokodil mocht je aan raken, gids was vriendelijk en legde van alles goed uit,

title: Krokodillen aaien
text:
De krokodillen poel is leuk om te bezoeken, wel klein maar leuk.
Het museum geeft uitleg over het land zelf, is dus interessant. Dan korte wandeling tot bij de krokodillen waar er enkele van kunnen aangeraakt worden.

title: Quite different!
text: A good local trip and interesting museum that explains a great deal of the Gambian History. The crocs were very "crocy"

title: Leuk om te bezoeken
text:
Als je naar de krokodillenpool gaat kun je gelijk een bezoek brengen aan het museum van Bakau. Museum is niet groot maar wel erg leuk om even te kijken. We waren er met gids die veel vertelde over de geschiedenis. 

De krokodillenpool is leuk om te bezoeken. Grote vijver met 100 krokodillen waarvan enkele exemplaren aangeraakt kunnen worden. Het heilige water brengt voorspoed en zorgt voor vruchtbaarheid bij ongewenst kinderloze echtparen (zo is het verhaal). 

Gewoon een leuk uitje.
Toegangsprijs is 100 Dalasi dus daarvoor hoef je het niet te laten.

title: Lite obehagligt
text: F√∂rst ett museum med bl a traditionella dr√§kter som anv√§nds vid festen i samband med den kvinnliga omsk√§relsen. Sedan ett g√§ng stora l√∂sa krokodiler som de ville att vi skulle klappa och k√∂pa mat till. Jag √§r mest glad att vi inte blev upp√§tna sj√§lva!

title: Lagom l√§skigt
text:
Trevlig liten oas med lagom sp√§nningsfaktor. Vi hade egen guide med oss, men parkens egna var ocks√• v√§ldigt trevlig.
Litet museum i anslutning till entr√©n om Gambias olika stammar. F√∂rv√•nansv√§rt fr√§scha toaletter.

title: V√§rt ett bes√∂k
text:
Vi b√∂rjade med ett bes√∂k p√• ett litet museum som handlade om Gambias historia. Vi var d√§r med en lokal kille ‚Äùguide‚Äù, vilket √§r det b√§sta att g√∂ra tycker vi. Sedan klappade ‚Äùgubben‚Äù p√• en av krokodilerna. Det var en ‚Äùkrokodilguide‚Äù p√• plats, s√• det var inte s√• att man kunde springa runt och klappa hur som helst. Sj√§lv h√∂ll jag mig lite p√• avst√•nd. Respekt! Krokodilerna matas varje dag och det g√•r √•t 250 kg fisk dagligen. De matas inte med k√∂tt. Detta skall g√∂ra krokodilerna m√§tta och det √§r d√§rf√∂r de √§r d√•siga och inte attackerar folk. Dock s√•g vi en som verkade aggressiv, men den gillade inte att bli st√∂rd.

title: You get really close to crocodiles
text: This place is great!  You can actulally pet one of the crocodiles.  The history of how the pool was established was interesting.  Worth a visit!

title: A place to get close to crocodiles
text: Quite an experience!  Not for those scared of crocodiles.  The pool is full and you can watch them moving about and climbing out of the water and walking near you.  The staff are friendly and give advice on how to approach the crocodiles and touch them.  Have been several times and the place always fascinates.  The museum is interesting but tired.

title: Versteckt im Dorf - OK f√ºr 15 Minuten Stippvisite
text: Der Park ist im Grunde ein Teich mit Krokodilen, die weil stark gef√ºttert im Prinzip nur umher liegen. Man kann als Highlight die Krokodile streicheln, was aber auch nicht allzu umwerfend ist. Kann man machen, um das H√§kchen zu setzen.

title: Super miejsce
text:
Polecam zdecydowanie, cena to 100 dalasi. 
Mo≈ºna dotknƒÖƒá krokodyle. I zobaczyc nie wielkie muzeum. 
Fajna sprawa !

title: Halvtama krokodiler.
text: Efter man betalat intr√§det tar guiden med bes√∂karen till museet till h√∂ger innanf√∂r ing√•ngen. Det finns en stig som leder runt inom omr√•det och d√§r f√•r man k√§nslan att man befinner sig i en djungel ! Bra guider !

title: Tr√®s touristique.
text: Excitant de se rapprocher des crocodiles. Voyage pas cher. L'√©tang n'est pas propre et il y a trop de crocodiles dedans. Tr√®s touristique.

title: Weniger als erwartet
text: Der Crocodile Pool wird gro√ü angeboten. Es handelt sich tats√§chlich nur um einen Pool und ist eigentlich in 10 min abgehakt. Krokodile gibt es allerdings reichlich. Es wird ein Trinkgeld zus√§tzlich zum Eintritt erwartet.

title: Krokodillen aaien
text: De entreeprijs is 100 Gambiaanse foppen. Het museum over de Gambiaanse geschiedenis is modern en steekt het Nationaal Museum naar de kroon (al is dat niet zo moeilijk). De krokodillen, zo‚Äôn 70 exemplaren, leven al heel lang rondom dit meertje. De populatie houdt zichzelf in stand door niet erg groot te worden en door middelen van geboortebeperking. Zouden mensen ook eens moeten doen. Aanraken van de krokodillen mag. Af en toe hapt er een ge√Ørriteerd naar je, maar de meeste krokodillen liggen vooral bij te tanken.

title: Vies water en klein
text:
Op voorhand hadden we enige twijfels om hier naartoe te gaan, uiteindelijk hebben we het toch maar gedaan.
Het is laagdrempelig en goedkoop, maar het is wel gewoon een 'vies watertje' met veel te veel krokodillen. Dat kan vast niet goed zijn. Niet een must om naartoe te gaan.

title: Sorprende cocodrilos sueltos, hay museo con explicaciones de tradiciones
text: Dicen que no atacan porque s√≥lo comen pescado, mi teoria es que no atacan porque les dan de comer cada d√≠a. Di una propina para que compren comida

title: Wie so oft ist der Weg das Ziel.
text:
Wenn man die Tour selber macht. 
Nehmt euch ein SUV .
Die " Stra√üen" sind sonst kaum befahrbar. 
Aber man bekommt auf dem Weg einen Einblick wie die Menschen hier leben und wie Arm das Land ist.
Der Park an sich ? Naja . Mit einem F√ºhrer der einem das Museum zeigt bekommen wir einen kleinen Einblick in die Geschichte Gambia s und man kann , wer es mag, Krokodile streicheln. 
Zeit 30 Minuten .
Kosten 1- 2 Euro.

title: veel krokodillen
text:
toen wij in gambia waren bracht onze gids ons onder andere naar de krokodillenpool, achteraf best wel eng eigenlijk je mag ze ook aaien. heel vreemd ook. 
maar leuk een keer meegemakt te hebben.

title: Pas terrible
text:

title: Great Expierience
text:
Me and my girlfriend went it was an amazing experience 
You get very close to the crocodiles and can even touch them 
Definitely a must when in Gambia

title: Ganz nett und lohnenswert
text: In der Anlage befindet sich ein kleines Museum, wo einige Masken ausgestellt und die Geschichte Gambias kurz angesprochen wird.Es war ganz nett, dort die Reptilien aus naher Distanz zu sehen und zu streicheln.Zu diesem Ausflug sollte man aber keinesfalls vergessen M√ºckenspray mitzunehmen.F√ºr 100 Dalasi ca.2,-absolut lohnenswert.

title: Esperienza piacevole.
text: Certo, passeggiare tra i coccodrilli non √® una cosa molto comune per√≤ √® stato bello vedere questi animali da vicino. Il parco √® un po' troppo piccoli per ospitare tutti quegli animali, alcuni dei quali sono davvero grandi!

title: Leerzaam en leuk
text:
Als je binnenkomt betaal je en kan je in het museum gaan. Daar zie je veel over de Gambiaanse cultuur. Levenswijze, hekserij, muziek, presidenten etc. Heel erg leerzaam dus. 

Zodra je buiten komt zie je al meteen krokodillen die vrij en los rondlopen en liggen. Voor een paar euro heb je een persoonlijke gids die jou alles over de plaats kan vertellen. Over de witte krokodil en over onvruchtbare vrouwen. Aan het eind van de rondleiding kan je een donatie geven. Dit geld gebruiken ze om de krokodillen mee te voeren. Als je echt iets wilt betekenen koop dan eerst vis op de markt en neem dit dan mee.

title: Crocodile is gevangenschap, toch voel je je er vrij!
text: Crocodile pool, niet bijzonder maar wel leuk om even te gaan kijken! Ook het ritje er naar toe is al een beleving :)

title: Familienurlaub
text: Dieses mal nur Frau und ich. Die Angst w√ºrde uns wohl genommen, aber die Tiere werden sicher sehr gut gef√ºttert.

title: Annorlunda upplevelse
text:
V√§gen till parken √§r i sig en upplevelse. En √§kta gambiansk by med vattenbrunn p√• torget, korrigerade pl√•tskjul och oblyga barn som vill h√•lla handen. 

I parken √§r det krokodilerna som avg√∂r var du kan g√•. De √§r helt fria inne i parken och du f√•r anpassa dig efter var de √§r. Vi fick veta att de blir matade varje morgon s√• att de inte √§r hungriga n√§r turisterna kommer... s√• d√§rf√∂r √§r de helt ofarliga.... ;-) 

Parken √§r r√§tt liten men √§nd√• v√§l v√§rd ett bes√∂k.

title: Aussergew√∂hnliches Erlebnis
text:
Nach √ºber 20 Jahren war ich wieder hier, um es war erneut eine tolle Erfahrung. Neben den Krokodilen, die sich wirklich anfassen lassen, gibt es auch ein kleines Museum am Eingang, welches die Geschichte und Kultur Gambias kurz behandelt.
Man sollte sich ein gr√ºnes Taxi besorgen, um den Ort ziemlich ungest√∂rt besuchen zu k√∂nnen, und vielleicht von dort aus noch zum Bakau Fischmarkt zu fahren.

title: Crocodile park
text: This place you have to visit, if you go to Gambia. Crocodiles are free inside this park and you go there to they area. You can touch one of the crocodile, call Charlie and that was quite schary, but it was safety. There is "nanny"  with you and they told, that they give 250 kg fish every day to crocodiles, so they are calm. Must visit place.

title: Bijzonder....................
text: Een bijzondere ontmoeting met deze reptielen zonder enige bescherming...‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. Geen hekken, muurtjes of wat dan ook en dan laat men je ook nog eens deze reptielen "aaien"...‚Ä¶. Tsja, je moet er wel van houden!

title: Sehr beeindruckend
text: Wir waren mit einer gro√üen Gruppe in dem Park. Die Krokodile zu streicheln war eine sch√∂ne Erfahrung. Wie schon beschrieben, werden die Krokodile mit Fisch gef√ºttert.

title: Sure, why not. Pet a croc.
text: It is an interesting place,no doubt. I ve seen and held crocodiles before so maybe I was bit more immune to the excitement other people experienced. Still, it was a good way to spend some time and the opportunity to touch them and pet them is great. You can get some nice pics. I still keep wondering why were they so lazy, even to eat a fish, barely moving,almost all of them. I ve been assured they are not sedated, just overfed... .

title: Beeindruckend mit beklemmenden Gef√ºhl
text: Es ist schon mutig zwischen mehreren √ºber 2 m langen Krokodilen zu stehen. Sie anzufassen (wer es sich traut) einzigartig. Eine kleine Spende gibt man da gerne. Der F√ºhrer erkl√§rt alles und f√ºhrt durch die Anlage. Sch√∂n fanden wir die Urspr√ºnglichkeit und das der Kommerz noch nicht Einzug gehalten hat. Wir sind auf eigene Faust mit dem Taxi hingefahren und waren zu 4 die einzigen G√§ste am Nachmittag.

title: Fantastic!
text: What a great place! Really enjoyed going around the museums, very interesting, but absolutely loved seeing the crocodiles, I got to stroke one, which is a first for me. Wonderful experience!

title: Tr√®s beau parc de petite taille
text: Tr√®s belle exp√©rience, vous pourrez toucher les crocodiles, ils ne sont pas drogu√©s certains avancent lentement et quand le garde donne un ordre , ils se couchent.Entr√©e 100 dalasis ( mus√©e et crocodiles)

title: Lamgil trips
text:
Another leg  of our excellent trip with lamin (lamgil trips and excursions).

The guy who talks with s brilliant English accent talks with passion how he looks after the crocodiles.

A brilliant experience and please leave a tip as this is how he feeds the crocodiles.

Brilliant

title: Leuk om eens een krokodil te aaien
text:
Op zich is het niet veel zaaks, maar als je toch in de buurt bent, dan kan je maar beter eens van de gelegenheid gebruik maken om eens een krokodil te aaien.
Het kost niet veel geld om binnen te komen. Je krijgt een klein museum te zien, en nadien kan je dan een krokodil aaien, en je krijgt er wat uitleg bij.

title: Krokodile
text: Die Krokodile lassen sich streicheln, da sie von Geburt an nur mit Fisch gef√ºttert werden. Der Park ist nett angelegt, die Guides erkl√§ren alles gut und sind nett. Man muss sich allerdings bewusst sein das der Pool in einem der √§rmsten Vierteln der Stadt liegt. Schon schwierig zu sehen wie man dort leben muss. Sind dort hin gelaufen, haben √ºberall freundliche und hilfsbereite Menschen getroffen.

title: Excellent
text:
Until now the closest I had ever come to seeing the crocodile was through the television
I know you can see them in a zoo but it‚Äôs not the Same as seeing them for real this beats the Zoo experience

title: Sp√§nnande upplevelse
text: Med ett visst m√•tt av skr√§ckblandad f√∂rtjusning bes√∂kte vi st√§llet. Vi tog mod till oss och klappade ett par av krokodilerna utan att bli av med en enda kroppsdel üòä

title: Old Crocs
text: Worth a visit but nothing to write home about, the small musemn before you go in is very interesting and tells how life was in the earlier days.

title: Krokodillen aaien
text:
De ‚ÄòKatchikally Heilige krokodillenvijver‚Äô is mogelijk niet de meest spectaculaire activiteit in Bakau, maar bijzonder is het wel om tussen een 6-tal krokodillen door te lopen en er een of meer (over de rug) te wrijven of te aaien. Waar kun je dit elders? Wij bezochten Katchikally in het kader van de door ‚ÄúAfrican Adventure Travel & Tours‚Äù georganiseerde, half daagse ‚ÄúOrientation Tour‚Äù. De boeking hebben we afgesloten bij de reisleiding van Corendon; prijs: ‚Ç¨ 30,- p.p. Feitelijk hoort dit bezoek ook bij de ‚ÄòColeur locale‚Äô van de kustplaats Bakau en is een bezoek daarom best aan te bevelen.
Je kunt dit ook op eigen gelegenheid doen; het is 20 minuten lopen vanaf hotel Sun Beach (Kofi Annan Street) naar deze pool. Misschien is het aanbevelenswaardig om je door een lokale gids (overal wel in de buurt van de hotels aan te treffen) te laten begeleiden want de laatste 500 meter gaat door een aantal ‚Äì althans voor onze begrippen sloppen en steegjes ‚Äì waar je je mogelijk niet helemaal op je gemak zult voelen.
Bijzonder groot is de vijver niet; in minder dan 10 minuten loop je er helemaal omheen. Een gids vertelt iets over de ontstaansgeschiedenis en het feit dat het water vruchtbaarheidsbevorderend zou werken. Dus wie wil douchen met dit water is bij deze uitgenodigd. Aan de ingang is een klein museum ingericht. Bij de rondleiding gaat er helaas door het gebrekkige Engels een deel van de informatie aan je voorbij.
Maar met een krokodil op de foto blijft toch altijd een aandenken‚Ä¶

title: Interessant en laagdrempelig
text: Als je je vakantie aan de westkust doorbrengt, is dit een leuke bezienswaardigheid als je nog een uurtje overhebt. Wij waren hier met onze vakantiegids Buba en hij weet enorm veel te vertellen over de krokodillen, maar ook zijn natuurlijke vijand die hier rondloopt! Het is niet heel groot, er staat nog een klein museum en een prachtige boom. Aan een uurtje heb je wel voldoende. Interessant om te bezoeken, niet duur.

title: Amazing
text:
What an amazing experience from when you arrive to see the interesting museum with local instruments and the history of The Gambia, then on to the crocodile pool. not quite knowing what to expect its surreal to see the crocodile roaming free and to be able to touch them. All this for 100 GD.
 bargain.

title: Sp√§nnande
text: Vi var d√§r f√∂r fem √•r sedan f√∂rra g√•ngen. Nu √•terv√§nde vi med ett barnbarn p√• 4,5 √•r. V√§ldigt annorlunda att uppt√§cka allt p√• nytt med ett barn. Absolut ska man dit och klappa krokodiler. Skillnaden denna g√•ng var att det ‚Äùtiggdes‚Äù pengar till krokodilmat. V√•r lokalguide avr√•dde oss.

title: Krokodile zum Anfassen
text: Wir sind als Gruppe vom BB Hotel mit dem Fahrrad hingefahren, vorbei an den Botschaften, Residenzen, aber auch durch die Sandwege des Ortes. Krassere Gegens√§tze kann man nicht sehen. Aber auch die arme Bev√∂lkerung ist sehr, sehr freundlich. Eingangs des Parks zun√§chst das Museum zur Historie des Landes, dann der Weg durch den Park, vorbei am riesigen Silk Tree hin zum Krokodilteich. Von Guides werden ausreichende Erl√§uterungen gegeben und dann - wer mag- d√ºrfen freilaufend Krokodile unter Aussicht gestreichelt werden. Lohnende Besuch, sehr zu empfehlen.

title: Crocodile pool
text: De gids kent alle krokodillen en verteld je de ins en outs! Bijzonder om krokodillen van zo dichtbij te kunnen zien en te kunnen aanraken! Ook het kleine museum is even de moeite waard om langs te gaan.

title: Crocodiles + museum = experience!
text:
Read somewhere that people had written that the museum on site wasnt according to the ‚Äùstandard‚Äù they were used to. I think these people have the wrong expectations.

The museum and the park itself is small but it tells you a lots of stories about The Gambia; history, politics, people, the different tribes and their customs (clothes, instruments). I got a lot of insights during this visit, and I am thrilled to understand some of the differences and similarities between the different tribes.

Walking towards the crocodile pool we passed a -huge- tree with a hollow body that could encircle ten of us (photo session time), a lots of other trees and lianes (shadow!), and fields were the women work with the family crops (photo session time).

The crocodile pool was at first glance not that much to talk about, but suddenly they were crawling up to meet us and there were crocodiles everywhere. Cool and a bit scary :)

If you want to be close to a crocodile, go here. If you dont, stay home.
And, dont be stupid, they are still crocodiles even when they are recently fed ;)

title: Crocodille Charlie bezocht en een Krokodil geaaid.
text: Leuke krokodillen bad. leuk personeel. Leuk om 1 van zo dichtbij te zien en aan te kunnen raken zonder gevaar.

title: Tama Krokodiler....
text:

det √§r en liten pool... naturpool man kan g√• runt med ca 200 krokodiler‚Ä¶. ligger i Bakau s√• det √§r ingen l√•ng utflykt men kanske 1-2 timmar

title: Dont expect to much
text: We took a taxi from the hotel, about ¬£3, and he waited for us.  At the end of a narrow track is the crocodile pool, a small fee of about ¬£1 to enter.  There is a small museum which is interesting and crocodiles lying around a pool.  They are wandering around freely so dont stand too close.  There is a stall and a lady making tea.  A nice afternoon visit.

title: Pieni pettymys
text: Koko paikka oli pettymys. P√§√§si kyll√§ koskettelemaan krokodiilin mutta. Paikka oli yksi pieni kuoppa miss√§ eleli kuulemma monta sataa krokotiili√§, rahaa halusivat sis√§√§np√§√§syn lis√§ksi viel√§ sis√§ll√§ krokotiilien yll√§pit√§miseen.

title: Nature at its finest
text: With a historical museum to walk through, educating us of Gambian soldiers who fought in the world war and local traditional practices, and much more was a nice informative way to start of a great trip. To see crocodiles up close in the flesh, at such peace is a true experience. Been twice now once with and once without children. Both very enjoyable experiences.

title: Overroepen
text: Een bezoek duurt maximaal 10 minuten, waar je √©√©n krokodil kan aanraken, en dan loop je rond een pool van zo'n 100 andere krokodillen. Een beetje zielig en echt goed onderhouden lijkt het zeker niet

title: Okay
text: There was nothing worth writing home about. Just a bunch of zonked crocodiles which wasn‚Äôt really my idea of interesting but was recommended by one of the locals. A bit overpriced but thankfully negotiable. It‚Äôs better suited for families, I‚Äôm sure children would enjoy the experience more.

title: An experience
text: We did not realise when we booked this trip that the crocs are roaming free. We enjoyed the experience of being up close, touching and sitting on one of them. It was a very small place and a quick trip.

title: Give it a miss
text:
Highly overrated and a real tourist con as has been the case for a long time 
The crocodile that you are able to feel is heavily drugged.
A total waste of time.

title: nice place to visit
text: the beach around this restaurant is great, very quiet and beautiful. We only had drinks here but we enjoyed the quiet and lack of people who want to sell you little knickknacks. the crocodiles were sleeping, we sadly missed the feeding. It would be nice if they had a note somewhere when they will feed the crocodiles, otherwise a nice place to be

title: Stroke a crocodile!
text:
Sacred and historic crocodile pool stocked with West African crocodiles. Crocodiles are well fed and used to being approached by humans. Informative museum.
Need a guide to find as not signposted from the road.

title: Intressant m√∂te
text:
Utan att ha bokat n√•got s√• tog vi en taxi till denna krokodilpark. Vi gick runt i deras museum som kanske inte h√∂ll den standard som vi √§r vana vid p√• ett museum men en hel del intressant information fanns d√§r. 
V√§l framme vid krokodilerna s√• fick vi en man som f√∂ljde med oss och informerade glatt om alla krokodiler. Ju mer vi fr√•gade desto gladare blev han och ber√§ttade g√§rna allt han visste. 
Sp√§nnande att luta sig halvv√§gs in i en krokodils gap n√§r den l√•g och solade sig samt att f√• klappa dem lite i deras vila. 
V√§l v√§rt ett bes√∂k. Intr√§det kostade 100 dalasi per person.

title: Lots of crocs!!!
text:
Loads of crocs & can get really close to some. Difficult to find but just ask a local.
Small museum on local culture.

title: Wonderful
text: Excellent food, great staff and a beautiful location.  The seafood is wonderful, home grown herbs and salads, good wine and garlic bread to die for!  Live music by two talented guys made the evenings special.

title: Few Crocodiles
text: Overhyped- has to travel a long way to see a few lazy crodiles. Everywhere busters inside and out hassling you to touch the crocodile etc for money. Never leaves you alone

title: Was determined not to go
text: Before leaving the UK this was one place I had made up my mind I definitely wasn‚Äôt going. However, we booked a last minute day trip - and this was included so I decided to brave it. I wasn‚Äôt aware of the museum at the start so that was nice and very interesting addition. Particularly enjoyed the instruments which our guide said I was allowed to have a go on. On the walk from the museum to the crocodile pond there‚Äôs a very interesting tree trunk formation which you can walk inside. Don‚Äôt miss it. I was so busy walking and talking to the guide I didn‚Äôt realise til I was right upon the crocodiles! I thought my heart would stop. They were laying across the bank, motionless with their mouths wide opened (this is how they cool off). There were some others with their mouth closed and the pool guide invited us to come stroke them. It took me over 15 minutes of coercion to gently touch one with my finger. The guides are really good, patient and knowledgeable. There‚Äôs a little gift shop there. I found it impossible to relax at all whilst there as I was so scarred but once I‚Äôd left a sense of adrenaline overcame me and I couldn‚Äôt believe I had braved it. Guide took a great photo of the inside of one of the opened mouths. Good, clean toilet.

title: T√© commercieel.
text: Je bezoek duurt 5 minuten. Een kuil met veel krokodillen en √©√©n exemplaar dat je kan aanraken. Voor iemand die nog nooit een krokodil in de zoo bij ons gezien heeft, ok.

title: Tourist trap
text: It's nice if you have kids but it's a bit of a tourist trap.  It looks like the crocodiles are drugged.

title: Crocodile dundee
text:
Ok, het is echt een enorm gave ervaring om een krokodil aan te raken, eerlijk is eerlijk, maar toch was ik persoonlijk niet erg onder de indruk van de crocodile pool. 

Misschien net even iets te klein qua omgeving voor mij. Bij de entree heb je eerst een museum, daarna zie je echt een paar enorme grote bomen, en dan kom je direct bij een kleine vijver met een tig aantal krokodillen die lekker liggen te zonnebaden. Voelde allemaal wellicht wat onnatuurlijk aan, ondanks dat het van oorsprong wel natuurlijk is. Komt hoogstwaarschijnlijk ook door het hek waar je langsloopt richting de krokodillen...

Voor de gambianen overigens een heilige plek en positief gericht op het vinden van juiste partners en het krijgen van gezonde kindjes! Die gedachtegang is wel mooi natuurlijk!üòä

title: Small and uncomfortable
text: The crocodiles were small and just everywhere. Some you could pet/touch and some you shouldn‚Äôt go near. It was really small there and not big at all. Wouldn‚Äôt have visited it if it wasn‚Äôt on the tour we went on.

title: Don‚Äôt miss this
text: What an experience! Very cheap to get in, lovely little museum at the start, the crocodiles roam around, I touched one!!! Our guide was brilliant telling us all about the crocs and it was really interesting, I‚Äôm so glad we visited, highly recommended

title: Worth a visit
text: The park was within walking distance of our hotel however we incorporated this into a tour day with Abilie Jobe( his stand is opposite Ocean Bay Hotel he is a great guide excellent English speaker very knowledgable and much cheaper than the tour operators price) I got to stroke a crocodile. The museum at the park is very interesting 100 Dalasi just over a ¬£1.

title: visit
text: Walked on the beach to see the pool. Crocodiles were too sleepy to take any notice. We're not hungry.

title: NOT for faint hearted!
text:
An amazing experience that i do not think you can do anywhere else on earth and 100% NOT in Europe!!!

Get upclose and personal with one of the most deadliest animals on earth.

You literally ENTER the home of these crocs that walk around freely, just one rule DO NOT touch them by the head area if you want to come out in one piece! 

I cannot recommend this place highly enough! Also there is a museum that is really educational.

title: Fascinating Place to Visit
text:
We were brought here by our guide for the day. A fascinating place to visit where the sleepy crocs come out of the water to relax in the sun. They look very relaxed and seem used to visitors touching them.
There's a small museum to visit on the site and some unusual birds to observe within the grounds of the pond.
We could also see the local ladies working on the adjoining allotments where they draw water from a well and then use a bucket with holes in the bottom to water their crops - slow hard work!

title: A must.
text: Had an amazing time visiting this centre, our guide was most informative. Paid 100 Dallas I on entry, but tipped our guide for his work.

title: Lovely
text:
A really enjoyable visit to the crocodile pool, thanks to my local guide from Gambia friendly tours..
I will definately come back next time i visit.

title: Amazing to stroke them
text: Went along to the pool and quite a few crocodiles. Texture of them is very strange but well done to the staff and guide. An experience well worth it

title: Great hidden gem
text:
Great place to visit, has a small museum with aincent masks and musical instruments together with the history of The Gambia.
A short walk and your at the pool, surprisingly small but has lots of crocodiles. You actually get the chance to touch and feel a real crocodile 
This is a charity so all donations are welcome, a few locals selling their souvenirs but no hard sell
or hassle 
Well worth a visit

title: Average
text: lots of crocodiles but not a lot of movement. Asked for extra money to support the crocodiles. Take hand wash with yu as you are asked to touch the crocodiles.

title: alles ok
text:
Die Fahrt dort hin Afrika style ,wie soll ich das erkl√§ren.
sehenswert um Banjul.Die F√ºhrung gut.soviel Krokodil Z√§hne die sie dort verkaufen k√∂nnen nicht von diesen Gehege stammen

title: Interesting visit
text:
Good way to pass a couple of hours strolling tgrough tge museum and getting to know a bit about the history of Gambia. The crocodiles are fed twice a day and happy to be stroked and photographed following the guides instructions. 
There are around 100 crocodiles that roam free in and around the pool area, so watch where you walk. There are also lizards roaming around and a fascinating Elephant tree. Well worth a visit.

title: The trip was as good as the crocs
text:
We met a lovely person on the beach named JoJo that took us on the trip. 

It started with a walk (15 minutes) through "the real africa" were the Gambian people live their day to day lives. 
This walk was a big "eye-opener" and gave me and my girlfriend a lot of emotions, to see how they REALLY live. You can't experience that at the hotels. 

Then we arrived at a small museum where we learned about The Gambia. And after that we meet the reptiles. It's crazy how close you can get to these beasts. 
But it's very safe and the owners are there to comfort you, haha. 
I can really recommend this trip. 

And i want to give a big shoutout to our new friend JoJo. He made our Gambian vacation a lot better.
If you want to experience The Gambia i really recommend you guys to contact JoJo.

title: No merece la pena
text: Lo √∫nico interesante del sitio es un √°rbol precioso de 300 a√±os. Los cocodrilos est√°n hacinados en una peque√±a piscina natural, hab√≠a uno fuera que te dejaban tocar, parec√≠a como drogado, daba pena ver los animales...

title: Crocs....
text: We came here as part of our 6 in 1 day tour.  The little museum was interesting - our guide explained about the musical instruments and tribal culture and then you go to see the pool which is still considered sacred by the locals.  I would question the taking of tourist pictures with the crocs on the bank and suspect that the creatures are doped up in some way to make them docile and allow people to get up close to them.  There were hordes of people milling around when we were there which seemed a little surreal.  Worth seeing for the experience but like I say, I do question the photo taking......

title: Well worth a morning or afternoons visit
text: We had an amazing and extremely knowledgeable guide who's name I'm ashamed to say has completely escaped me. He gave us a wonderful insight into the area's history including the part many of them played during the war for the allies as well as the tribal history of the area. The crocodile park itself is amazing, your literally a few feet from them and if you work with the guides you can actually touch them. Was a shame to see a few tourists not abiding by the guides requests/rules and putting themselves into dangerous situations so please listen to the guides as they are experts with these animals and are extremely aware of keeping them safe too. Make sure you take a bag of lollipops for the local kids too

title: Trip
text: Well worth a visit. Guide there takes you through a bit of a history of Gambia some interesting items on show.

title: M√•nga v√§stafrikanska krokodiler.
text: Inte europeisk klass p√• djurpark. Lite obehagligt att inte krokodilerna var inh√§gnade utan l√•g l√∂sa framf√∂r f√∂tterna p√• en.

title: Krokodiili mesta
text:

Ep√§usko valtaa kulkijan l√§hestytt√§ess√§ puistoa, koska tiet ja talot ovat aivan kuin slummia.  Tien p√§√§ss√§ on kuitenkin kyll√§isi√§ krokoja ja niit√§ voi taputella jos uskaltaa. Ei hinnalla pilattu jos ei ole ennen krokoja koskenut. Kannattaa ottaa autokuljetus puistolle, n. 5 eskoo per nen√§. 
Lazy crocodiles and small museum about Gambia history.

title: R√∏r ved en krokodille.
text: Gik hen til krokodille parken med lokal guide. Der var 100 krokodiller p√• stedet. De gik frit rundt mellem os. Vi klappede en af dem (ca. 2 meter lang) p√• ryggen og l√∏ftede p√• dens bagben. Det skal pr√∏ves. Kun 50 kr. i entre.

title: Very cool!!
text: Amazing experience! Never thought I would ever touch a crocodile! They are very relaxed and don't mind people being around. Great value for money

title: Touching Crocodiles
text:
I visited cricodile pool with Black and White tours. There is a little museum which has intetesting history relating to Gambia and tribal culture. The pool itself is fenced off but the crocodiles are together by pool. There are guides based there for different languages. They let you touch crocodiles but dont touch the crocodiles heads. My guide from Black and White took great pictures.
You can buy real crocodile teeth.
An amazing place to visit

title: Enjoyed
text:
Been here a few times when in Gambia with my children . They love it. You get up close with the crocodiles as they move about or lay there resting after been fed on fish . You can see them in the crocodile pool swimming by. 
 Before you get to the crocodiles there is a very intesting museum with history of The Gambia and it‚Äôs men who contributed to the war for England . A place with traditional musical instruments and another room with cultural jujus . 
The guides are very good and will take you for photos with the crocodiles. 
I would recommend a visit here when visiting The Gambia .

title: 6 in 1 tour
text: There's probably a few travel operators providing this tour and there's certainly plenty of locals offering a taxi style trip. But mine was booked through our Gambia experience rep and included the crocodile pond and museum tour. These fish eating crocodiles! once fed are quite content to bask in the shade whilst tourists mingle with them and touch their bodies. It's quite surreal and has a complete disregard for elf n safety or so it appears. The museum is small and informative on the history and culture of the country. Other stops include markets and a tea and coffee stop at a waterside lodge and a traditional wrestling match which was fun. A beach stop to a very pretty beach was some drive  and a decent lunch provided. The last stop to a fishing village was cancelled due to time. Travel was in a open top bedford lorry which was also fun, generally a good experience albeit a little expensive.

text: Erstes mal ein Krokodile ber√ºhrt war sehr beieindruckend. Im Teich und auf den Wegen waren√ºber 20 Krokodile zu sehen.

title: Good
text: Worth a visit but not exceptional. They request a donation for food for the crocs! You can have your pic taken whilst touching them

title: Truly amazing
text: This is a magnificent place that I have been to 3 times. There is an interesting museum documenting a lot of history. Then you go to the pool and there are over 100 crocs just basking in the sun. You can stroke them. Some people just lark about which is really pathetic as these are wild animals. Well fed on fish but still not to be messed with. Some fools think they are Crocodile Dundee and naturally the guides tell those people off. The crocs seemed happy enough to me. It is a marvellous place and I will go back many times

title: Mysigt
text: Liten krokodilpark, men en underbar upplevelse att vara s√• n√§ra och √§ven kunna klappa dessa varelser.

title: What a great place to visit
text: We were given a tour by the men who look after the crocodiles and what a great team they are showing you all the hiding places that the crocodiles use. A must visit if you are in Gambia.

title: S√∂mniga krokodiler
text:

Visade inget som helst intresse f√∂r n√•gotn eller n√•gon.
